text:
May 3, 1961
Mr, Loren B. Stone
Manager, KCTS-TV
University of Washington
Seattle 5, Washington
Dear Loren:
Would you be good enough to sit down and dictate your concept of
our relationship with NETRC and, for that matter, with all other
organizations and groups working with the general field of educational
broadcasting.
Much of what you said may ultimately appear In the mtnutes, but
I don’t have It In hand, and your skillful phrasing and statement of
position would be useful to me in passing on the sense of the meeting
to Jack White and explaining why the letter of agreement was tabled.
Aside from that one unfortunate incident, it was a good meeting and
I think we’ve come a long way in arriving at a better understanding
of our role and the directions we should take.
Cordially yours.
WGH:rkf
William G. Harley
President
